announcements.title: Manage Amazon SageMaker HyperPod clusters with the new Amazon SageMaker AI MCP Server
announcements.summary: AWS has launched a new Amazon SageMaker AI MCP Server that provides tools for setting up and managing HyperPod clusters. Amazon SageMaker HyperPod simplifies generative AI model development by enabling quick scaling of training, fine-tuning, and deployment tasks across clusters of AI accelerators. The MCP Server allows AI coding assistants to provision and operate these AI/ML clusters for model training and deployment.

announcements.title: Introducing AWS Network Firewall Proxy in preview
announcements.summary: AWS has launched Network Firewall Proxy in public preview, enabling centralized protection against data exfiltration and malware injection. The service can be set up in explicit mode with just a few clicks to filter both outbound application traffic and incoming responses. It helps organizations efficiently manage and secure web and inter-network traffic while protecting against spoofing attempts.

announcements.title: AWS Lambda adds support for Node.js 24
announcements.summary: AWS Lambda now supports Node.js 24, allowing developers to build serverless applications using both managed runtime and container base images with automatic updates. Node.js 24 is the latest long-term support release that will receive security and bug fixes until April 2028, offering developers a simplified and modern async-focused experience.

announcements.title: Amazon OpenSearch Service introduces Agentic Search
announcements.summary: Amazon OpenSearch Service has launched Agentic Search, an intelligent agent-driven search system that understands user intent and automatically generates OpenSearch DSL queries from natural language search terms. The new feature orchestrates appropriate tools and provides transparent summaries of its decision-making process through a simple 'agentic' query clause. This transforms how users interact with their data by making search more intuitive and automated.

announcements.title: Amazon SageMaker AI Inference now supports bidirectional streaming
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker AI Inference has added bidirectional streaming support for real-time speech-to-text transcription, allowing models to process continuous audio streams and return partial transcripts simultaneously as users speak. This enhancement enables the development of voice agents with minimal latency by eliminating the need for batch processing and providing real-time speech processing capabilities.

announcements.title: AWS Service Quotas adds now support for automatic quota management
announcements.summary: AWS Service Quotas has launched automatic quota management, a new feature that monitors quota usage and sends notifications through preferred channels (email, SMS, or Slack) when usage approaches limits. The feature can automatically and safely adjust AWS service quota values based on customer usage patterns. This capability is now generally available through both the Service Quotas console and API.

announcements.title: Amazon SageMaker AI now supports EAGLE speculative decoding
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker AI has added support for EAGLE speculative decoding, a new capability that can improve large language model inference throughput by up to 2.5x. This technology works by enabling models to predict and validate multiple tokens simultaneously instead of processing them one at a time, resulting in faster response times for AI applications in production.

announcements.title: AWS Glue Data Quality now supports rule labeling for enhanced reporting
announcements.summary: AWS Glue Data Quality now supports rule labeling, allowing users to apply custom key-value pair labels to data quality rules for better organization and reporting. This feature enables categorization of rules by business context, team ownership, compliance requirements, or any custom taxonomy that fits organizational needs. The enhancement improves filtering capabilities and enables more targeted reporting for data quality and governance initiatives.

announcements.title: AWS Glue Data Quality now supports pre-processing queries
announcements.summary: AWS Glue Data Quality now supports preprocessing queries in general availability, allowing users to transform data before running quality checks through AWS Glue Data Catalog APIs. This feature enables creating derived columns, filtering data, performing calculations, and validating column relationships directly within the data quality evaluation process. The enhancement provides greater flexibility for handling complex data quality scenarios.

announcements.title: Amazon Quick Suite introduces scheduling for Quick Flows
announcements.summary: Amazon Quick Flows now supports automated scheduling, allowing users to run workflows automatically at specified times or intervals without manual intervention. Users can configure flows to run daily, weekly, monthly, or on custom schedules, making it ideal for automating routine tasks like generating recurring reports. This enhancement improves operational efficiency and ensures critical workflows execute consistently.

announcements.title: OpenSearch Service Enhances Log Analytics with New PPL Experience
announcements.summary: AWS has enhanced Amazon OpenSearch Service by making Piped Processing Language (PPL) and natural language the default experience in the OpenSearch UI's Observability workspace. The update includes over 35 new commands for deep analysis and faceted exploration, designed to simplify log analytics workflows. This enhancement aims to help customers analyze large data volumes more intuitively while managing costs effectively.

announcements.title: Amazon CloudFront announces support for mutual TLS authentication
announcements.summary: Amazon CloudFront now supports mutual TLS authentication (mTLS), a security protocol that requires both server and client to authenticate each other using X.509 certificates. This feature allows customers to validate client identities at CloudFront's edge locations, ensuring only clients with trusted certificates can access their distributions. The enhancement helps protect against unauthorized access and reduces the implementation effort previously required by customers.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 announces interruptible Capacity Reservations
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 has launched interruptible Capacity Reservations, allowing organizations to make their unused On-Demand Capacity Reservations (ODCRs) temporarily available to other workloads within their organization. This feature helps maximize utilization of reserved compute capacity while maintaining the ability to reclaim that capacity when needed for critical operations. The enhancement aims to improve cost efficiency by reducing waste from underutilized reserved capacity.

announcements.title: AWS IoT Core now supports IoT thing registry data retrieval from IoT rules
announcements.summary: AWS IoT Core has introduced a new get_registry_data() inline rule function that allows IoT rules to dynamically retrieve device information from the IoT thing registry, including attributes, device types, and group membership. This enhancement enables better filtering, enrichment, and routing of IoT messages by leveraging registry data directly within rule processing. The capability is particularly useful for scenarios like filtering connectivity lifecycle events based on device attributes stored in the registry.

announcements.title: AWS Elemental MediaTailor now supports HLS Interstitials for live streams
announcements.summary: AWS Elemental MediaTailor now supports HLS Interstitials for live streams, allowing broadcasters and streaming providers to insert personalized advertisements and promotions seamlessly into live content. This new capability uses the HLS Interstitials specification (RFC 8216) and works natively with popular video players like HLS.js, Shaka Player, and Bitmovin.

announcements.title: Amazon Redshift now supports federated permissions across multi-warehouse architectures
announcements.summary: Amazon Redshift has introduced federated permissions to simplify permission management across multi-warehouse architectures. This new feature allows customers to define data permissions once from any Redshift warehouse and automatically apply them across multiple warehouses, addressing the need for consistent access control as organizations scale and isolate workloads. The capability streamlines permissions management for customers using distributed Redshift deployments.

announcements.title: Amazon U7i instances now available in Asia Pacific (Jakarta) Region
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 U7i instances with 6TB of memory are now available in the Asia Pacific (Jakarta) region, powered by custom 4th generation Intel Xeon Scalable Processors. These high-memory instances feature 448 vCPUs and DDR5 memory, designed to enhance transaction processing throughput for data-intensive workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect flow modules now support custom inputs, outputs, and version management
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect flow modules now support custom inputs, outputs, and branches, enabling more flexible and reusable business logic components. Users can create modules like authentication systems that accept parameters (phone number, PIN) and return results (customer name, status) with conditional branches. The update also includes version and alias management capabilities for better module governance.

announcements.title: AWS Glue announces catalog federation for remote Apache Iceberg catalogs
announcements.summary: AWS Glue now offers general availability of catalog federation for remote Apache Iceberg catalogs, enabling direct and secure access to Iceberg tables stored in Amazon S3 through AWS analytics engines. This feature allows users to query remote Iceberg tables without moving or copying data, while synchronizing metadata in real-time between AWS Glue Data Catalog and remote catalogs.

announcements.title: Amazon Quick Suite Embedded Chat is now available
announcements.summary: AWS has launched Amazon Quick Suite Embedded Chat, allowing developers to integrate conversational AI capabilities directly into their applications without building chat interfaces from scratch. The service combines structured and unstructured data in conversations, solving the problem of users needing to switch between different tools to get answers. This enables businesses to provide AI-powered chat functionality within their existing applications where users are already working.

announcements.title: Amazon MSK Replicator is now available in five additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: Amazon MSK Replicator, a feature that enables reliable data replication across Amazon MSK clusters, is now available in five additional AWS Regions: Asia Pacific (Thailand), Mexico (Central), Asia Pacific (Taipei), Canada West (Calgary), and Europe (Spain). This expansion allows customers in these regions to easily replicate streaming data across Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka clusters with just a few clicks.

announcements.title: AWS Lambda announces enhanced error handling capabilities for Kafka event processing
announcements.summary: AWS Lambda has introduced enhanced error handling capabilities for both Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) and self-managed Apache Kafka event sources. These new features enable customers to create custom retry configurations, optimize failed message retries, and route failed events to designated Kafka topics as on-failure destinations. This enhancement allows developers to build more resilient Kafka workloads with improved error handling strategies through Lambda's event source mappings.

announcements.title: Claude Opus 4.5 now available in Amazon Bedrock
announcements.summary: AWS has made Claude Opus 4.5 available through Amazon Bedrock, Anthropic's newest model that delivers advanced AI capabilities for coding, workflows, and office tasks at one-third the cost of previous Opus models. The model achieves state-of-the-art performance on software engineering benchmarks like SWE-bench and excels at professional development tasks. This integration allows AWS customers to access Opus-level intelligence through Bedrock's fully managed foundation model service.

announcements.title: Amazon OpenSearch Service now supports OpenSearch version 3.3
announcements.summary: Amazon OpenSearch Service now supports OpenSearch version 3.3, which delivers enhanced search performance, improved observability, and new functionality designed to simplify agentic AI integrations. A key feature is agentic search, which allows users to achieve precise search results using natural language inputs instead of complex domain-specific language (DSL) queries, along with improved vector search capabilities.

announcements.title: Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL introduces dynamic data masking
announcements.summary: Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL now supports dynamic data masking through the new pg_columnmask extension, enabling simplified protection of sensitive database information. This feature provides column-level data protection that works alongside PostgreSQL's existing row-level security and column grants. Users can implement SQL-based masking policies to control how sensitive data appears to different users without modifying the underlying data.
